page.title: 10Lavender Line, Isfield.
page.content: {Isfield Station}was closed in 1967. It was left until 1983 when it was bought by a local family who have transformed it to a working{'museum'. The basic structure of the buildings was stable but a lot of things had been taken from the site. People took souvenirs but many were returned when they heard about the{restoration work which began by taking 2 tons of growth from the platforms and vegetation from the tracks. The signal box was then renovated and the perimeter fencing replaced. The Main Booking Hall needed more attention; ceilings were replaced and walls sandblasted. A lot of hard work by the family and about 20 regular{volunteers}has made the Line & its locos. an{attraction for local people & tourists. The owner feels that the Station has had a good effect on the village community.
